title: 108_hr3972
content:
The Act titled "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" allows state social services officers access to federal databases for specific purposes. The "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" grants state social services officers online access to federal criminal history databases for conducting checks on individuals who resided with minors during incidents of abuse or neglect. The "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" allows state social services officers to have read-only electronic access to the National Crime Information Center databases for conducting missing persons checks related to investigations of missing children. State social services officers can access the National Crime Information Center databases for missing child investigations and must share any information obtained with law enforcement agencies. Covered officers must meet federal standards for access and certification. The term "control terminal agency" refers to a criminal justice agency with access to the National Crime Information Center network. The term "State" includes various territories of the United States. SEC. 3. Access to III by National Center for Missing and Exploited Children includes Case Analysis Division, Missing Children's Division, and Exploited Child Unit. Access is granted based on meeting Federal standards. SEC. 4. Privacy Protections are ensured. SEC. 4. PRIVACY PROTECTIONS.

Information from checks or access under sections 2 and 3 cannot be altered except for national security reasons. It can only be shared with authorized individuals, and releasing it unlawfully can result in criminal penalties.
